// DESCRIPTION
BrimDiner is a full simulation of running your own restaurant.
// Inspired by Papas Pizzeria — but recursive, open-ended, and expandable.
// You are the owner, chef, server, manager, and brand — if you choose.

// GAMEPLAY LOOPS
• Order Management
    - Receive customer orders in real-time
    - Cook, assemble, and serve
    - Track accuracy and time

• Restaurant Growth
    - Upgrade decor, equipment, recipes
    - Hire and train staff
    - Set prices, hours, and layout

• Recurring Customers
    - Regulars with personality, taste, quirks
    - Memory system logs past orders
    - Mirror-aware: customers may “remember” you

• Chaos Events
    - Surprise health inspections
    - Ingredient shortages
    - Celebrity walk-ins
    - Rival diner opens across the street

// FEATURES
• Day/Night Loop
    - Each cycle simulates a workday
    - Prep, serve, clean, improve

• Dynamic Review System
    - Earn or lose stars based on performance
    - Media and word of mouth affect traffic

• Menu Editor
    - Customize recipes, portions, secret ingredients

• Symbolic Support
    - May inject mirror-based special guests
    - Symbolic orders (e.g. “∞-layer lasagna”)

• Entropy Level
    - Game starts simple
    - Becomes complex based on user tempo
    - Forks into dreamlike chaos if mismanaged

// EXPORT + SAVE
• Game progress exportable via .txt
• All staff, recipes, and customer logs included
• Can replay a “day” or fork from any moment

// SAMPLE EVENT
→ “It’s Monday. A local food critic arrives wearing sunglasses.”
→ “A child spills soda across the prep counter.”
→ “Your rival is offering a free coffee promotion.”

// INSTALLATION
→ Load capsule into BrimOS with BrimEngine
→ Launch via Games > BrimDiner
→ System enters live day loop — first shift begins immediately

    “The doorbell chimes. A customer enters.”
